statement: Says Kayleigh McEnany is John F. Kennedy Jr.’s daughter.
In Europe, "church attendance rates (are) in the single digits" because churches are supported by taxes.
Says Donald Trump called pregnant employees "an inconvenience."
"We’re talking about a law that would allow a child to be aborted right up to the moment of birth."

"The Federal Reserve system has presided over about a 95... percent decline in the U.S. dollar."
"Recent international reports show the United States near the bottom among industrialized nations for k-12 academic achievement."
"Under Governor Crist, 3,000 teachers laid off."
Says before he planned a rally on June 19 "nobody had ever heard of" Juneteenth.
"122 vicious prisoners, released by the Obama Administration from Gitmo, have returned to the battlefield."
Wisconsin was embroiled in a "constitutional crisis" brought on by the Democratic senators fleeing the state for Illinois to block Gov. Scott Walker's budget-repair bill.
Says Patrick Murphy is one of "only three Democrats in the House today who voted" to create the Benghazi committee.
Says Donald Trump "proposes cutting a half a billion dollars of local police support."
"The LGBT community is more often the victims of hate crimes than any other recognized group."
President Barack Obama "has now spent three years proving that he kills jobs in energy, he kills jobs in manufacturing."
"As compared to last year, Texas has about 15% more power generation capacity."
Says Mitt Romney "has a corporation in Bermuda (but) failed to disclose that on seven different financial disclosures."
Says Brett Kavanaugh’s mother presided over foreclosure case against Christine Blasey Ford’s parents, which fueled motivation for sexual assault accusation.
"Louisiana Sen. Mary Landrieu received almost $1.8 million from BP over the last decade."
Electric utility FirstEnergy's annual revenues are greater "than the GDP of Haiti, Kyrgyzstan, Iceland, or 15 African nations."
Red Bull contains bull sperm.
"United States of America is twenty-sixth in school performance in the world."

statement_originator: Public comments at a Common Core hearing
statement: Teachers were not involved in developing the Common Core State Standards.
"(George) LeMieux never requested a single earmark and pushed to ban them all."
"If you look at the states where soccer is most popular, they're overwhelmingly blue states, and the states where soccer is least popular are red states."

"Nothing in any of the Democrat bills would require individuals to verify their citizenship or identity prior to receiving taxpayer-subsidized benefits."
Says Democratic members of Congress who represent Cuban Americans in Florida and have been critical of Sanders "just so happen to be supporting other candidates."
Says Donald Trump supports "an agenda out there" to privatize the Veterans Affairs health care system.

Says Hillary Clinton said, "This planet might be able to support perhaps as many as half of a billion people who could live a sustainable life in relative comfort. Human populations must be greatly diminished, and as quickly as possible to limit further environmental damage."
"We see a quarter-billion dollars in a pension fund that needs to be funded at $1.2 billion."
"Half of all NC legislative candidates are unopposed because of gerrymandering."
"If you’re getting your insurance through (your employer), nothing changes" under Trumpcare.
A Ukrainian combat medic who died in February was seen in a video Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky posted of his visit to see wounded soldiers.
North Carolina could save "literally tens of millions of dollars" if it stopped prosecuting 16-year-olds as adults.
"The leading cause of death among children is a firearm."
"You go to a gun show, you can buy whatever you want, and no background check."

Says "we are overcharging students . . . to help pay for the health care law."
President Obama’s lawsuit claims it is unconstitutional for Ohio to allow servicemen and women extended early voting privileges during the state’s early voting period.
The merger of Georgia State University and Georgia Perimeter College will make GSU one of the largest universities in the nation, with more than 54,000 students.

"More lives are lost from violence against women, sex-selective abortion, female infanticide, suicide, egregious maternal mortality, and other sex-linked causes than were lost during all of the wars and civil strife of the 20th century."
Says about 25 Texas cities and 39 states have banned texting while driving.
Says Georgia Power customers pay 10 percent to 15 percent below the national average for electricity.
Trade deals threaten "India’s role as the pharmacy of the developing world" for new HIV medicines.
Georgia has the 9th highest rate of adults, ages 18 to 64, without a high school diploma or GED.
As a prosecutor, Wisconsin Supreme Court Justice David Prosser did not investigate or file charges in a case involving 30-year pedophile priest, then participated in cover-up.

The federal debt is more than $14 trillion, "almost equal to the size of our entire economy," and "every child born today inherits a $45,000 share of the national debt before they take their first breath."
The military arrested "bedridden Gavin Newsom."
"You must apply to get your second stimulus check! I’ve already filed for mine and will be receiving $2,000 a month for the rest of the year."
"We've got more revenue than we ever have."
Says author J.K. Rowling was the first billionaire to fall off Forbes billionaire list because of charitable giving.
"The ice caps were going to melt, they were going to be gone by now, but now they’re setting records, so okay, they’re at a record level."
Says Bernie Sanders "fundamentally changed the lives" of Immokalee farm workers in Florida for the better.
The House Zika bill "limits access to birth control services needed to help curb the spread of the virus" in Puerto Rico.
"We’re the most highly taxed nation in the world."
New provisions of the health care law bar the use of flexible spending accounts and health savings accounts to pay for aspirin and other non-prescription health needs.
"Your politicians in Tallahassee today are saying, in your area, that they don't need any more jobs. That is exactly what Rep. Paul Renner said."
"Between 1982 and 2007 the cost of a college education increased 439 percent."
Says Donald Trump will be re-inaugurated as president on March 4, 2021.
The fiscal cliff agreement was "the largest tax increase in history."
"If you were forced to use a Sharpie" to fill out your ballot, "that is voter fraud."
"Since ObamaCare and the stimulus passed, the unemployment rate in the U.S. has increased."
"By the time she turns 3 years old, a child born into a low-income home hears 30 million fewer words than a child from a well-off family."
"In our debate, Dan McCready doubled down on his support for Pelosi’s liberal agenda of … impeaching our president."
"For the first time ever, we completely funded the critical needs waiting list so persons with unique abilities can get the help they need."

Says Lake Erie contains more native fish than all the other Great Lakes combined.

"(Hillary Clinton's State Department) actually admonished one of her ambassadors because he wasn’t using the proper server."
"The Congressional Budget Office -- supposedly non-partisan -- estimates that in just a few years the average cost to every family of four (from cap and trade) will be $6,800 per year."
Says he did not say Republicans would filibuster immigration reform.
The Senate seat won in a special election by a Democrat had been "held for more than thirty years by Republicans."
Says Donald Trump wrote in his book, "Being an atheist gives me an edge in every deal. Christians are too moral for business."
"When I say Mexico is going to pay for the wall, that's what I said. Mexico is going to pay. I didn't say they're going to write me a check for $20 billion or $10 billion."
Says Congressman Steve Rothman voted against funding for President Barack Obama’s auto bailout and would have let automakers go bankrupt.
Starting in 2011, "you will be required to pay taxes" on "the value of whatever health insurance you are given by the company."

Says "as we sit right now, Medicare, if we do nothing, will be gone in eight years, if we do nothing to it."
Obama "basically threatened to bomb Pakistan."

Says "combined doses of vaccines" have never been tested.

Florida's economy "became a bad economy ... because of a huge spike in oil prices in the summer of 2008."
